bibl.title: The Survey Project at el-Deir, Kharga Oasis: First Results, New Hypotheses.
bibl.note: The site of el-Deir. - New questions, first results: 1. The history of the human settlement in the oasis milieu, linked with the problem of water availability, from prehistory to modern times; - 2. The role of el-Deir in the network of the desert roads, especially in Roman times.

bibl.title: The Oasis Papers 6. Proceedings of the Sixth International Conference of the Dakhleh Oasis Project

bibl.seg: Gaëlle Tallet, Jean-Paul Bravard, Romain Garcier, Stéphanie Guédon & Ashraf Mostapha, The Survey Project at el-Deir, Kharga Oasis: First Results, New Hypotheses.

Roger S. Bagnall, Paola Davoli & Colin A. Hope (edd.), assisted by Bruce E. Parr (Production Editor), The Oasis Papers 6. Proceedings of the Sixth International Conference of the Dakhleh Oasis Project = Dakhleh Oasis Project: Monograph No. 15 (Oxford, 2012) pp. 349-361, 5 figg., 6 pll.

The site of el-Deir. - New questions, first results: 1. The history of the human settlement in the oasis milieu, linked with the problem of water availability, from prehistory to modern times; - 2. The role of el-Deir in the network of the desert roads, especially in Roman times.
